"""Tries to fix issue with many applied rules associated to delivery"""
 delivery = state_change['object']
 
 if delivery.getPortalType() not in delivery.getPortalDeliveryTypeList():
 raise TypeError('%s is not a delivery' % delivery.getPath())
 
 portal = delivery.getPortalObject()
 
 kw = dict(
 portal_type='Applied Rule',
 default_causality_uid=delivery.getUid()
 )
 
 root_applied_rule_count = portal.portal_catalog.countResults(**kw)[0][0]
 
 if delivery.getPortalType() == 'Sale Packing List' \
 and delivery.getCausalityValue(portal_type='Sale Order') is not None:
 limit = 0
 always_remove = True
 else:
 limit = 1
 always_remove = False
 
 if delivery.getPortalType() == 'Purchase Packing List':
 limit = 0
 always_remove = True
 
 if root_applied_rule_count <= limit:
 # nothing to do
 return
 
 delete_candidate_id_list = []
 
 rule_list = [q for q in portal.portal_catalog(**kw)]
 rule_list = rule_list[limit:]
 for root_applied_rule in rule_list:
 if always_remove or len(root_applied_rule.contentValues()) == 0:
 delete_candidate_id_list.append(root_applied_rule.getId())
 
 portal.portal_simulation.deleteContent(delete_candidate_id_list)
